name: Grayscale Image
summary: Learn about .GRY files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: The images that GRY files contain are not camera raw files. In this case, raw refers not to the fact that an image is unprocessed (like a camera raw image), but the fact that the image's data is unstructured (it contains no header or footer, is uncompressed, and does not use a color palette). Because GRY files contain raw image data, many programs cannot display the images they contain unless you provide accompanying metadata.

instructions: You can open a GRY file with XnViewMP. XnViewMP allows you to view the image your GRY file contains, make simple edits to the image, and export it in a variety of more common image formats.
You can use XnViewMP or Newera Graphics Converter Pro to convert a GRY image to more common image formats. For example, XnViewMP can convert GRY files to the following formats (and many others):
